item.title: 'Forrest Gump' Star Gary Sinise on Real Life Military Inspiration
item.description: The role of Lt. Dan changed his life. Gary Sinise discusses the profound impact that meeting and working with real soldiers had on his career and his later life's work as a veteran advocate

media:content.media:title: 'Forrest Gump' Star Gary Sinise on Real Life Military Inspiration
media:content.media:description: The role of Lt. Dan changed his life. Gary Sinise discusses the profound impact that meeting and working with real soldiers had on his career and his later life's work as a veteran advocate

item.title: Why Navy Seal Doesn't Wear Trident
item.description: Ever wonder why you see Navy SEALs without their Trident insignia? This video breaks down the specific reasons, covering official protocol, operational security, and the personal choice of the veteran.

item.title: A veteran's story of enduring captivity.
item.description: This powerful memoir shares a veteran’s somber and unfiltered account of the profound hardship and psychological abuse he endured while a prisoner of war in Vietnam.

item.title: The costly river crossing that started the fight.
item.description: Ernest “Ernie” Mogor along with the 76th Infantry Division would enter combat crossing the Sauer and Moselle Rivers in the vicinity of Echternach, Luxembourg. The river crossing was met with heavy German resistance and gave Mogor his first taste of combat.

item.title: How We Dealt With a Japanese Sniper on Tarawa
item.description: Go inside the brutal reality of the Battle of Tarawa. This video documents a soldier’s courage and critical tactics used to deal with a persistent and lethal enemy sniper.

item.title: Breaking Down the AC-130 Gunship
item.description: This technical guide goes inside the AC-130. We'll show you how the massive armaments and advanced technology come together to make it one of the most feared aircraft in combat.

item.title: Medal of Honor recipient and Vietnam Veteran Harvey Barnum Jr. explains what “Skipper” means in the Marine Corps.
item.description: What is the meaning of "Skipper" in the Marine Corps? Medal of Honor recipient Harvey Barnum Jr. explains the traditional term and its deep significance within the corps.

item.title: The path to becoming a Navy SEAL: Edward Byers' story.
item.description:
Edward C. Byers Jr. aspired to become an elite soldier in the United States military. After a deployment with the 26th Marine Expeditionary Unit in 1999, Byers was accepted to attend Basic Underwater Demolition/SEAL training. He graduated with BUD/S Class 242 and fulfilled his dream of becoming a Navy SEAL.
He shares the mental and physical hurdles he had to overcome while training to become a Navy Seal.

item.title: What Happened the Moment I Was Captured
item.description: Go inside the mindset of a soldier facing the impossible. This video documents the unfiltered reality of the moment of capture and the immediate aftermath of being taken prisoner.

item.title: The First Hours During The Battle of Fallujah
item.description: What were the first hours of the Battle of Fallujah really like? This powerful memoir shares a veteran's first-hand account of the intense, critical moments when the operation began.

item.title: The German Guards Did Anything To Avoid Capture
item.description: What motivates a soldier in the final days of a losing war? This powerful memoir shares a veteran's story, detailing the extreme measures taken by some German troops to avoid capture near the war's end.

item.title: Wounded and Alone During an Enemy Ambush
item.description: What happens when a soldier is wounded and isolated under heavy fire? This powerful memoir shares a veteran's story of courage, survival, and the sheer determination required to make it through a devastating ambush.

item.title: Easy Company Vet on Joining The Paratroopers
item.description: What motivated a young man to join the Airborne? This video shares an Easy Company veteran's powerful story, revealing the personal reasons and intense motivation behind his decision to become a paratrooper.

item.title: The Enemy Heard My Voice As We Rained Fire on Them
item.description: Go inside a high-stakes combat mission. This veteran recounts the incredible pressure of guiding heavy fire onto enemy positions, detailing the precision and calm required in the heat of battle.

item.title: Easy Company's Veteran Recalls D-Day & Normandy
item.description: What was it like to land on D-Day? This veteran from the famed Easy Company shares his powerful, first-hand account of the jump and the intense combat in Normandy.

item.title: His Last Act Saves Squadron
item.description: What does it take to perform a selfless final act of heroism? This video tells the powerful, true story of a pilot whose courageous final moments ensured the survival of his entire squadron.

item.title: Taking the Fight to Nazi Germany in a B-17 Flying Fortress
item.description: What was it like to fly bombing missions over Nazi Germany? This powerful memoir shares a veteran's story of courage, endurance, and the high-stakes missions aboard a B-17 Flying Fortress.

item.title: A Marine's story of landing on Iwo Jima.
item.description: This somber memoir details the brutal reality of the Battle of Iwo Jima. PFC Ted Below recounts the terrifying conditions faced by the first wave of Marines landing on the beach.

item.title: The One Thing You Can't Simulate About Space Travel
item.description: Go behind the scenes of astronaut training. This video reveals the single greatest challenge of space travel that modern science has not been able to reproduce in a simulator.

item.title: In Fallujah We Had The Green Light to Engage Any Threat
item.description: What was it like to operate under the Rules of Engagement in Fallujah? This video shares a veteran's first-hand account, detailing the intense combat and the critical protocols that governed their actions.
